name: Althea

discussion.message: Airdropped

@Schenectady asked in our chat: "Hi frens. I just did the airdrop
I am interested in learning more about the token supply.
Is this product going to be available in Sweden?

replyList.message: @abbe-berg If you organize a network, it will!

discussion.message: Hi I am from México, do I need an authorization from the government to implement this project in México?

replyList.message: @ari-bon-san I'm not 100% sure, but I think it is pretty easy in Mexico.
@jehan-tremback While there are some licensing requirements, we can help you through that process.
@jehan-tremback in order to contact him/her, is it possible to share me his profile Republic name profile.
@ari-bon-san That's me!

discussion.message: Hi there, can I purchase additional tokens? Also .. when can we expect instructions on how to create our Cosmo wallet address?

replyList.message: Hi Belinda- We're not planning to sell any tokens at this time. On the Cosmos address- we're currently working to get our blockchain set up.
@belinda-elkaim Thank you ;-)

discussion.message: Hi. Internet services (21mbs- 100mbs) in Romania using mostly fiber in cities, starts from 6 eur up to 15 eur/month.

replyList.message: @ciprian-matrache-1 It depends on health of the local retail internet market, since internet access for an Althea network.

discussion.message: Since the software is open source - will it be possible for someone to add some code to take advantage of users by using an automatic price exploration algorithm?

replyList.message: Absolutely! We plan to have a well defined plug-in point for pricing plugins. Our first pricing plugin is just hitting a server to get a sane price.

discussion.message: Is the software 5g campatible
I have done the quiz. I am thinking about doing a plan. However I am in Australia. In my area you can pay AUD60 a month for a good internet connection.

replyList.message: @vicki-zyznik Depends on how good it is. In one of our networks in Oregon, USA, people are paying 20-50 USD for speeds of around 80mbps.
@jehan-tremback Will put a proposal together, i am a CPA. I was a financial controller for many years. I am very confident in finance and any of those area.
@vicki-zyznik Thanks! We find that it's best when organizers in an area form a team, with at least one person who is good at planning/coordinating and people.
@jehan-tremback Thank you for the suggestion. My husband is a good candidate for the technical side of thing. I see what I can do.

discussion.message:
> I'm currently looking through the videos on Republic, and it was
mentioned that Althea would address the need for anonymity.
How do I cancel my participation? The quizzes are too time consuming.
I passed the first quiz. the others were overly time consuming for the answers.
Get rid of the quizzes, after done 2.......................I no longer bother!
Watched the videos more than once, I took the quizzes and had my participation cancelled. I'm still very interested in Althea though.

replyList.message: @baron-huntington Hi Baron, please find and click the "uncancel" link on your participation page: republic.co/portfolio/althea
@peter-green Thank you.

discussion.message: What's the proposal process? How do we set up a relay node? Do you provide any equipment or do we need to invest in it?

replyList.message: @cameron-roe How to make a proposal should be explained in the video. After you make a proposal, we will reach out and help you plan and start your network.

discussion.message: Hi. Can you elaborate more on the validator? What does it do? How does it work? What is the thought process of having people bet tokens on them? etc.

replyList.message: @john-sargent Great question. The validators will process transactions on the Althea blockchain to allow routers to pay each other.

discussion.message: Can you not make people watch hour long videos to learn about Althea and pass the ridiculous quizzes filled with traps? What's the fastest way to learn about Althea???

replyList.message: @dominator-dominator This granting program is primarily intended to get people up to speed to be able to start a network in their community.

discussion.message:
A question asked off-site was "Hi, the only way to invest althea is joining airdrop? Any way to purchase token?"

The answer is that at this time, no.
Is it open for international participation? 50-% 75% Target ROI

replyList.message: @onur-gunduru It's open to most jurisdictions. Republic has an FAQ here: republic.co/help/category/investing

discussion.message: I live in a large apartment building. How do I participateP

replyList.message: @fruma-kane Thanks for asking! You can start by watching all the videos, and move on to making a proposal for a network in your area.

content: First compliant security airdrop for everyone. Your participation is technically a an investment, but no USD payment is required
Althea wants you to be a decentralized Internet Service Provider in your community
Althea is giving away 1M of its tokens in this first ever security airdrop campaign
The Althea token (ALTG) entitles holders to receive a portion of transaction fees from the Althea network
Earn tokens by learning about the project or becoming your own ISP
Anyone in the world over 18 years old can participate
Your participation is technically an investment, but no USD payment is required. $38.77 raised from 3877 participants
Ways to earn
Once you click participate and join the airdrop, you’ll be offered ways to earn your tokens!
About the project
Althea is building a faster, cheaper, decentralized internet
Althea is a system that lets routers pay each other for bandwidth. This allows people to set up decentralized ISPs in their communities.
Faster
Althea is faster, because anybody in the community is able to expand and improve the network and get paid for investing in faster equipment.
Cheaper
Althea's price-aware routing protocol makes sure that traffic takes the cheapest path. Your router gets the best prices, second by second.
Decentralized
Althea networks are made up of nodes owned by the people who use them. Communities get faster, cheaper internet by cutting out the middleman.
How it works
Althea can be deployed in any environment
End users load up their device or wifi router with blockchain money to pay for internet access.
A mesh of rooftop transmitters forward packets. They earn money and compete to provide service.
Gateway nodes sell access to the internet, competing with other gateways in the area.
Investors
Althea token model
ALTG holders control the Althea blockchain, and receive 50%-70% of the revenue in the Althea system.
ALTG holders must stake their ALTG tokens to receive this revenue.
To stake their tokens, ALTG holders select a validator, which is a server which processes transactions on the blockchain.
If a validator misbehaves or goes offline, the ALTG holders who have their tokens staked with this validator will lose a small.
We cannot recommend specific validators, but once the chain has launched, you will be able to see
How to participate
Earn tokens and become an Althea organizer
Althea organizers set up and maintain Althea networks in their communities. They don’t get payments for bandwidth, these go to .
We’ve set aside 33% percent of the total ALTG allocation to be granted to organizers, users, and people learning to become organizers.
Ways to earn
Once you click participate and join the tokens: from simply learning about Althea, to setting up your own network!
Participate in the Althea
airdrop for free
Claim tokens
The participation in this airdrop is an investment done via regulation crowdfundingAbout Althea
